content: Stocks Discussion Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked 4w agoHow do I find out who are the owners of the companyâ€™s restricted shares?To paraphrase my question, when the float is not 100%, some of the outstanding shares are not available for public trading. Is it possible to find out who are the owners of these restricted shares?2 answersAnswerBump2

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardUpdated 4w agoYou can try buying the business shareholding on ACRA Bizfile if it is Singapore based. You can do so here: https://www.bizfile.gov.sgUsually, if it's either listed or PTE LTD you should be able to do so.Hope it helps!0 comments1

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered 4w agoYou can check the annual reports on who are the major shareholders. However, some of them hide behind custodian accounts.0 comments0
